lst.name: sentence
lst.str: S. National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration seeks lucrative commercial bids to lauch future weather satellites, ending its long-standing dependence on the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Companies and countries with established satellite launching operations may also get a jump on eventually providing other space-based services, particularly if the proposed international manned space station is launched as planned in the early 1990s.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Still, NASDA is free from private competition at home and has the full support of the government, since aerospace was chosen by the Ministry of Trade and Information as one of the country's new industries for the next decade.
